anpl:
def draw_pixel(grid: np.ndarray, coordinate):
    (x, y) = coordinate
    grid[x - 1][y - 1] = blue
    grid[x - 1][y + 2] = red
    grid[x + 2][y - 1] = green
    grid[x + 2][y + 2] = yellow

def main(input_grid: np.ndarray) -> np.ndarray:
    coordinates = "find all left-top coordinates of 2x2 grey squares"(input_grid)
    for coordinate in coordinates:
        draw_pixel(input_grid, coordinate)
    return input_grid
name: 95990924.json

description.object: In the input, you should see... a series of gray squares
description.size: The output grid size... is the same as the input
description.description: To make the output, you have to... surround each square with the following, connected diagonally to each of the corners: Blue on the top left, Red on the top right, Green on the bottom left, Yellow on the bottom right. The end result should almost resemble a flower, with a gray center and four colored petals.
